details.title: India scales up testing, Centre calls it an effective tool to limit COVID-19
details.content:
India has scaled up its testing capacity from one in January to more than 7.7 cr in October. With progressively falling positivity rate, testing has worked as an effective tool to limit the spread of #COVID19 infection: Union Ministry of Health & Family Welfare pic.twitter.com/RfmiioJFyK

— ANI (@ANI) October 4, 2020

details.title: Probe launched after COVID-19 patient dies due to lack of oxygen in Maharashtra
details.content:
In the video, the woman, who had been admitted to the facility but was waiting for allotment of bed, can be seen pleading that she needed oxygen facilities quickly to survive.

details.title: Global update | US President Donald Trump has made 'substantial progress' in COVID-19 treatment
details.content:
#UPDATES "President Trump continues to do well, having made substantial progress since diagnosis," his physician Sean Conley says
"While not yet out of the woods, the team remains cautiously optimistic" pic.twitter.com/xNr3YiXXvC

— AFP news agency (@AFP) October 4, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 vaccine: AMC-KGH starts process of volunteer registration
details.content:
ndhra Medical College-King George Hospital has set the ball rolling for human trials of Covid-19 vaccine Covishield. KGH superintendent and AMC principal PV Sudhakar told The New Indian Express here on Saturday that they received vaccine samples and began registration of volunteers.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Staying healthy at Delhi's covid care centre
details.content:
#WATCH Delhi: #COVID19 patients perform yoga organised by Indo-Tibetan Border Police at ITBP-run Sardar Patel COVID Care Centre & Hospital, Radha Soami Satsang Beas in Chhatarpur.

More than 1200 patients are admitted here currently & 5500 patients have been discharged so far. pic.twitter.com/MmACpwQTi3

— ANI (@ANI) October 4, 2020

details.title: Home treatment of Covid-19: Odisha issues SOP on use of Favipiravir tablet
details.content:
Odisha government on Saturday issued an SOP on the use of Favipiravir tablet by Covid-19 patients and asked district officials to ensure availability of the drug that can be administered to patients having symptoms under the supervision of trained doctors.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

A total of 7,89,92,534 samples tested for #COVID19 up to October 3. Of these, 11,42,131 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) pic.twitter.com/4MpeYH9I5Q

— ANI (@ANI) October 4, 2020

details.title: Demand to increase tests as TPR crosses 14 per cent in Kerala
details.content:
Public health experts say that if the number is increased to one lakh and beyond, it will greatly help the state’s system. Till date, the highest number of samples processed on a day was 63,682 — last Wednesday — when the fresh cases crossed the 8,000- mark for the first time. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India’s Covid-19 tally crosses 65 lakh-mark with one-day jump of 75,829 cases
details.content: As per Union Health Ministry's data, 940 deaths were also reported taking the toll to 1,01,782 in the country.

details.title: Senior BJD leader and Odisha MLA Pradeep Maharathy loses battle to COVID-19
details.content:
• After testing positive for COVID-19 on September 14, he was admitted to Sum Ultimate Medicare hospital here. As his condition deteriorated, he was put on ventilator support on Friday
  • Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik and leaders cutting across party lines have condoled the passing away of Maharathy

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Gym owners take necessary COVID precautions as people head back to 'sweat it out'
details.content:
'Delhi’s weather doesn’t support outdoor exercising. Gyms are better as you are under controlled temperatures. Gymming is not only a huge stress-buster, but under the supervision of instructors, the other parameters of your body are also taken care of,' says Ajay Sethi, Owner of Phyaction.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Thank you Dakiya! Tales of postmen doing their bit during pandemic, lockdown
details.content:

details.title: Candidates appear for UPSC prelims exam following COVID-19 protocols
details.content:
• The UPSC, the central services recruiting body, in addition to existing guidelines, has announced additional norms in order to prevent the spread of coronavirus
  • The board said that candidates without mask or face cover will not be allowed entry into the exam venue 
  • It has also asked the candidates to bring sanitiser in transparent bottles
  • They should ensure social distancing and follow other personal hygiene protocols, the board added

(Photo | P Jawahar, EPS)

details.title: Passion for teaching brings success for these techies after lockdown blues
details.content:

details.title: ‘Unlock Education’ comes to aid of school kids hit by Covid-19 curbs in Odisha
details.content:
When the Covid-19 pandemic struck, throwing schools into a complete shut down, a group of students of VSSUT came together to literally ‘unlock education’ and ensure the children are not deprived of the guidance as done in normal classroom education.

details.content:
Jammu and Kashmir: Government organises cocoon auction in Srinagar to help the growers amid #COVID19 pandemic outbreak.

Shams-ud-din Shah, a grower says, "Buyers from all over India come here to buy. The cocoons of Kashmir have the best quality, hence their demand is high." pic.twitter.com/YrZ3I8u0D8

— ANI (@ANI) October 4, 2020

details.title: Madhya Pradesh reports 1,811 new cases, 27 deaths
details.content:
As many as 1,811 new COVID-19 cases were recorded in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday, according to the State Health Department. The total number of positive cases in the state stands at 1,33,918 including 19,807 active cases, 1,11,712 recoveries.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: The number of active cases today is 9,37,625
details.content:
For the 13th day in an unbroken string, India has maintained its steady trend of clocking less than 10 lakh active cases. The number of active cases today is 9,37,625. This is 7371 cases less than yesterday: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/0yvjVDJmg5

— ANI (@ANI) October 4, 2020

details.title: Entertainment update | 'Bigg Boss' is back amid COVID-19 with safety precautions
details.content:
Keeping in mind the pandemic and safety precautions, Salman Khan said this time there will be no live audience on the sets, adding the show feels empty without their presence.

details.title: Odisha reports 3,326 COVID-19 cases, 15 deaths in past 24 hours
details.content:
As many as 3,326 new COVID-19 cases, 4,066 recoveries, and 15 deaths were reported in Odisha till October 3, said the State Health Department. The total number of COVID-19 cases rise to 2,32,713 including 1,98,194 recoveries, 33,559 active cases and 907 deaths.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: All schools will remain closed for students in the capital till October 31: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia
Need to bring back Poshan Abhiyan at the level it was in pre-COVID times: UNICEF
details.content: There is a need to bring back the national nutrition mission at the same level it was before the coronavirus outbreak, said chief of UNICEF India (Nutrition) Arjan de Wagt. He said programmes under Poshan Abhiyan such as the functioning of ICDS, take-home rations and giving pregnant women and children iron folic tablets to prevent anaemia need to be fully implemented again.

details.title: COVID-19 pushed breast health to low priority: Survey
details.content: With COVID-19 currently occupying the front seat on priorities for personal and public health, women seem to pushing their breast health to the recesses, by neglecting their mammograms and increasing nervousness to visit their physicians because of the possibility of contracting COVID-19, a new survey has shown.

details.title: Less than 10 lakh active cases for 13th consecutive day in country
details.content: For the 13th day in an "unbroken string", India has maintained its steady trend of clocking less than 10 lakh active cases of COVID-19, the Union Health Ministry said on Sunday. It also said that an average of 11.5 lakh tests for detection of coronavirus infection were done on a daily basis during the past ten days.

details.title: 15 more COVID-19 cases in Himachal Pradesh
details.content: Himachal Pradesh has reported 15 new COVID-19 cases, taking the tally of people infected with the virus in the State to 15,710, said the Health Department on Sunday. According to the latest health bulletin, while 154 are cured cases, two persons have succumbed to the virus.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh Congress leader Naseeb Pathan succumbs to Covid-19
details.content: Former Congress MLC Naseeb Pathan died of COVID-19 at the Medanta Hospital on Sunday, with party leaders condoling his demise.

details.title: Tripura reports 322 new COVID-19 cases, four more fatalities
details.content: At least 322 more people tested positive for COVID-19 in Tripura, pushing the tally in the state to 26,874, a health department official said on Sunday. The death toll rose to 290 with four more people succumbing to the infection, he said. West Tripura district, of which state capital Agartala is a part, has accounted for 157 of the 290 COVID-19 deaths.

details.title: Make mask-wearing a social medicine against COVID-19: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi
details.content: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Kiran Bedi called upon the people to make mask- wearing a social medicine to prevent the increase in the number of COVID-19 cases. In her message to the people through video, she said that after easing of lockdown and the COVID-19 restrictions, people should adopt mask-wearing as it could be a social medicine to stem the spread of the infection.

details.title: Centre estimates to utilise 40-50 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses on 20-25 crore people by July 2021: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan
details.content: The Centre estimates to receive and utilise 40-50 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccine covering 20-25 crore people by July next year and it is preparing a format for the states to submit by October-end their list of priority population group to receive the vaccine, Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan said on Sunday.

details.title: Andaman tourism industry looks forward to upcoming festive season for revival
details.content: With the Andaman and Nicobar Islands' administration opening up some parts of the archipelago for tourism after a gap of six months, stakeholders in the industry are looking forward to Durga Puja for the revival of the sector on which a large number of people in the Union territory depend for livelihood.

details.title: 144 cops tested positive for COVID-19 in the last 24 hours: Maharashtra Police
details.content:
144 police personnel tested positive for #COVID19 in the last 24 hours, taking total cases to 24,023 in the force including 21,030 recoveries, 2,743 active cases and 250 deaths: Maharashtra Police pic.twitter.com/ql6tK7q1OV

— ANI (@ANI) October 4, 2020

details.title: Around 8,000 COVID-19 patients discharged from LNJP hospital since March, highest in India: Official
details.content: Around 8,000 coronavirus patients have so far been discharged from the Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital here after recovering from the infection, the highest in any government hospital across the country, according to officials. As many as 331 women, who tested COVID-19 positive, have given birth in the hospital, also the highest in the country.

details.title: Will be back soon, ready for 'real test' ahead: US President Donald Trump
Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Odisha COVID situation
details.content: I spoke to senior experts of health sector from Bhubaneshwar's AIIMS & ICMR about testing & health protocols observed. These institutes are cooperating with the state govt. We estimate that the situation will improve here: Dharmendra Pradhan, Union Minister, on Odisha COVID situation

details.title: The death toll stands at 6,029 in Uttar Pradesh
details.content:
5,226 recoveries reported in the last 24 hours. There are total 46,385 active cases, while 3,62,052 have recovered. The recovery rate stands at 87.35%. The death toll stands at 6,029 now: Uttar Pradesh Principal Health Secretary Amit Mohan Prasad. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/ntMqkzEl7a

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) October 4, 2020

details.title: Our utmost priority is how to ensure vaccine for each and everybody in the country: Union Health Minister
details.content: Our government is working round the clock to ensure that there is a fair and equitable distribution of vaccines, once they are ready. Our utmost priority is how to ensure vaccine for each and everybody in the country: Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan in his 'Sunday Samvaad'

details.title: Delhi Police used drones for effective surveillance of containment zones
details.content: The Delhi Police used drones for effective surveillance of containment zones to combat the threat of coronavirus, a police official said.

details.title: Delhi reports 2683 new cases of COVID
details.content: Delhi reports 2,683 new COVID19 cases, 3,126 recoveries/discharges/migrations and 38 deaths today. details.title: Vande Bharat mission footfall
details.content: More than 19.7 lakh people have returned to India & flown out since Vande Bharat Mission began on May 6, 2020: Civil Aviation Minister Hardeep Singh Puri
